results.title: Leave it to the chimneys
results.creator_credit: Anti Cancer Council and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Seeks to educate the viewer about the hazards of cigarette smoking. Animation and medical photography reveal what smoking can do to the lungs. Directed towards young teenagers who may be making up their minds about whether they should smoke or not. No other credits available.

results.title: You've got to work for it (TEFC)

video_links.name: You've got to work for it (TEFC)

results.brief_description: A film made by six Diploma of Education students (Bob Sharples, Kamal Monsour, Sally Ford, Derek Burrage, Denis Connolly and Doug Eastman) about the problem migrant adolescents face in Australia. Through group discussions between Italian immigrants, Greek immigrants and first generation immigrant children, a real portrayal of the frustration of immigrant teenagers growing up in Australia is shown. Also gives a brief background history of Greek/Italian migration in the 1960’s and 1970’s from an economical/political point of view. Broadmeadows

results.title: You are not alone
results.creator_credit: Jennie Blackwood, Anti Cancer Council and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a woman who reports a suspected cancer early and undergoes a successful operation. Dramatically presents the advantages of seeking prompt treatment when the warning signs of cancer appear. The patient is referred to a surgeon who, after the operation, introduces the therapy radiographers who complete the treatment to eradicate the disease.

results.title: [The White continent]
results.brief_description:
Please be advised, this film contains graphic footage of animal cruelty.

In late 1949, a joint expedition planned by the Governments of Britain, Norway and Sweden left for Queen Maude Land on the Antarctic continent - this was to be the first truly international expedition to the Antarctic. The film covers the first stage of the journey, from departure point in Europe to the establishment of the base camps and later withdrawal of the ship’s party, leaving the groups of scientists to their study of the unknown world of ice and snow. Photography by Tom Stobart.

results.title: Venezuela
results.brief_description: Although rich in oil, Venezuela is beset with staggering problems. Poverty is rife in its capital - Caracas - where thousands of Indians dwell in one-roomed ranchitos. At the opposite pole are the rich with virtually no middle class between the two. The region of Orinoco seems immune to improvement and overall continued development in Venezuela depends largely on increased efforts in the areas of education and economic reform.

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Luci Clark, South Australian Film Corporation and Newfilms
results.brief_description: Carcass classification has taken much of the guesswork out of pig marketing. As a more objective measure in assessing the quality of the pork, classification is better for both producer and consumer. Explains the benefits to the farmer, and the way modern computers program and store production details. Cast includes Brian Moore, Flo Watson, Peter Brechin, Darcy Button, Keith Arnfield.

results.title: T is for Tumbleweed
results.creator_credit: Louis Clyde Stoumen, James A. Lebenthal and Camera Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: Portrays without commentary the racing, creeping, leaping travels of a tumbleweed and the encounters it has with people, animals and things. Photographed by Haskell Wexler.

results.title: Summer scene
results.brief_description: Shows tourist attractions of Western Australia’s South West region in spring and summer. Includes wildflowers, spectacular Karri forests near Pemberton and the Pemberton swimming pool, trout fishing, and Yallingup’s caves and rocky coastal beaches.

results.title: Run nickel run: the making of a movie
results.creator_credit: Syd Donovan and TVW Channel Seven
results.brief_description: Documents the making of the feature film “Nickel Queen”. This Australian production directed by John McCallum and starring Googie Withers told the story of the widowed owner of the Mirribilli pub’s sudden turn of fortune during the mining boom in Western Australia. Includes a scene with John Laws as a hippie.

results.title: Pictures and words
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television training film”.
Deals with the art and techniques of writing film commentaries. Illustrates the best way of making shot lists, timing the words with the pictures, and letting the pictures speak for themselves. Shows the pitfalls of various techniques, how the same pictures can tell a different story with a different commentary and what a skilful writer can do. Ends in the dubbing theatre with commentary, music and effects being recorded to the pictures.
